wikitext.*:
'''Calacirian''' was a region of [[Eldamar]] near the entrance to the ravine of [[Calacirya]]. The hill of [[Túna]] stood there, with the city of [[Tirion]] built upon it. The light of the [[Two Trees]] was the strongest there in all Eldamar. The name appears in [[Bilbo Baggins|Bilbo's]] ''[[Eärendillinwë]]'' in [[Rivendell]]:{{FR|II1}}{{RGEO|Notes}}, p. 70 :''and seven lights before him sent,
as through the Calacirian
to hidden land forlorn he went.'' ==Etymology== The [[Quenya]] name ''Calacirian'' is a simplified ("anglicized") form of ''Kalakiryan'' (full ''Kalakiryandë'', derived from ''Kalakirya'').{{PE|17}}, p. 73 {{Seealso|-nd|l1=-andë}} {{references}} [[Category:Eldamar]] [[Category:Regions]] [[Category:Quenya locations]] [[fi:Calacirian]]
